class.name: Router
class.description:
Represents an IP routing domain instance.
It provides data plane isolation of routed traffic and control plane isolation of routing entities from other routing instances.
It allows for further fragmentation of the routing domain.
Dependencies: The maximum number of InterfaceIPv4 MO configured as loopback is 64.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='count(InterfaceIPv4[@loopback]) le 64'><value-of select="."/> Maximum number of InterfaceIPv4 configured as loopback is 64</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/InterfaceIPv4) le 256'><value-of select="."/> Maximum number of InterfaceIPv4 configured is 256</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/InterfaceIPv6) le 256'><value-of select="."/> Maximum number of InterfaceIPv6 configured is 256</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/RouteTableIPv4Static/Dst/NextHop) le 10000'><value-of select="."/>: Max number of NextHop MOs (10000 NextHops) under RouteTableIPv4Static exceeded.</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/RouteTableIPv6Static/Dst/NextHop) le 10000'><value-of select="."/>: Max number of NextHop MOs (10000 NextHops) under RouteTableIPv6Static exceeded.</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/DnsClient) le 1'><value-of select="."/> Maximum number of DnsClient configured is 1</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='count(InterfaceIPv4[@loopback]) le 64'><value-of select="."/> Maximum number of InterfaceIPv4 configured as loopback is 64</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/InterfaceIPv4) le 256'><value-of select="."/> Maximum number of InterfaceIPv4 configured is 256</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/InterfaceIPv6) le 256'><value-of select="."/> Maximum number of InterfaceIPv6 configured is 256</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/RouteTableIPv4Static/Dst/NextHop) le 10000'><value-of select="."/>: Max number of NextHop MOs (10000 NextHops) under RouteTableIPv4Static exceeded.</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/RouteTableIPv6Static/Dst/NextHop) le 10000'><value-of select="."/>: Max number of NextHop MOs (10000 NextHops) under RouteTableIPv6Static exceeded.</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/DnsClient) le 1'><value-of select="."/> Maximum number of DnsClient configured is 1</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: routerId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: ttl
attribute.description:
Default value of Time-To-Live (TTL).
The default value inserted into the TTL field of the IPv4 header of datagrams, originated from this instance, whenever a TTL value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: hopLimit
attribute.description:
IPv6 default hop limit.
The default value is inserted into the Hop Limit field of the IPv6 header of datagrams originated at this entity whenever a Hop Limit value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.

enum.name: AvailStatus
enum.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value.

enumMember.name: IN_TEST
enumMember.description: The resource is undergoing a test procedure. If the administrative state is locked or shutting down then normal users are precluded from using the resource.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating.

enumMember.name: POWER_OFF
enumMember.description: The resource requires power to be applied and is not powered on.

enumMember.name: OFF_LINE
enumMember.description: The resource requires a routine operation to be performed. This routine operation is to place the resource online and make it available for use. The operation may be manual or automatic, or both. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_DUTY
enumMember.description: The resource has been made inactive by an internal control process.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY
enumMember.description: The resource cannot operate because some other resource on which it depends is unavailable.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The service available from the resource is degraded in some respect.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The resource represented by the managed object is not present, or is incomplete.

enumMember.name: LOG_FULL
enumMember.description: This indicates a log full condition.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is locked. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency locked.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_FAILED
enumMember.description: The availability status of a resource that this resource depends on is failed or dependency failed.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is shutting down. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency shutting down.

enum.name: OperState
enum.description: The operational states of a resource.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is totally inoperable.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable.

derivedDataType.name: EcimEmpty
derivedDataType.description: This type represents a leaf that has no value, it conveys information by its presence or absence.

derivedDataType.name: Ipv4AddressAndPrefixLengthStr
derivedDataType.description:
'Unicast IPv4 address'/'prefix length' string.
IPv4 address specified in dotted-quad decimal notation in accordance with RFC791, without leading zeros. The IPv4 address is within the range [1-126,128-223].[0-255].[0-255].[0-255], 7-15 characters. The prefix length is a number from 0 to 32.
Example: 1.1.2.2/28

derivedDataType.name: EthPCP
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the PCP value for ARP packets using this interface (does only effect VLAN-interfaces).

class.name: InterfaceIPv4
class.description: IPv4-addressed termination point; interface on an IPv4 routing domain.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='not((@bfdStaticRoutes eq 1) and (count(@bfdProfile) eq 0))'><value-of select="."/> When bfdStaticRoutes is ENABLED, bfdProfile attribute shall refer to a valid BfdProfile MO</assert> <assert test='(@encapsulation and not(@loopback)) or (@loopback and not(@encapsulation))'><value-of select="."/> One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time</assert> <assert test='not(@loopback and (@bfdStaticRoutes eq 1))'><value-of select="."/> When loopback is set, value of bfdStaticRoutes attribute must be DISABLED</assert> <assert test='not(@loopback and ((count(AddressIPv4) ge 1) and (count(AddressIPv4[matches(@address,".+/32")]) lt 1)))'><value-of select="."/> Prefix length of loopback address must be /32</assert> <assert test='not((@loopback and @aclIngress) or (@loopback and @aclEgress))'><value-of select="."/> LOOPBACK interface is not allowed in ACL association</assert> <assert test='not((@aclIngress and (count(@aclIngress/AclEntryIpv4) eq 0)) or (@aclEgress and (count(@aclEgress/AclEntryIpv4) eq 0)))'><value-of select="."/> EMPTY AclIpv4 is not allowed in ACL association</assert> <assert test='not((@aclIngress and (../@routerId ne @aclIngress/../@routerId)) or (@aclEgress and (../@routerId ne @aclEgress/../@routerId)))'><value-of select="."/> Only AclIpv4 MO within SAME Router is allowed in ACL association</assert> <assert test='not((@aclIngress and contains(@encapsulation,"IpsecTunnel=")) or (@aclEgress and contains(@encapsulation,"IpsecTunnel=")))'><value-of select="."/> Ipsec Inner Interface is not allowed in ACL association</assert> <assert test='not((@bfdProfile and matches(@bfdProfile,".*,Router=.*,BfdProfile=.*") and (../@routerId ne @bfdProfile/../@routerId)))'><value-of select="."/>: BfdProfile may not refer to a different Router</assert> <assert test='not(@loopback and @egressQosMarking)'><value-of select="."/> The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IP Loopback interface</assert> <assert test='not(@egressQosMarking and contains(@encapsulation,"IpsecTunnel="))'><value-of select="."/> The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IPsec Inner interface</assert> <assert test='not(contains(@encapsulation,"IpsecTunnel=") and ((count(AddressIPv4) ge 1) and (count(AddressIPv4[matches(@address,".+/32")]) lt 1))'><value-of select="."/> Prefix length of Ipsec Inner interface address must be /32</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='not((@bfdStaticRoutes eq 1) and (count(@bfdProfile) eq 0))'><value-of select="."/> When bfdStaticRoutes is ENABLED, bfdProfile attribute shall refer to a valid BfdProfile MO</assert> <assert test='(@encapsulation and not(@loopback)) or (@loopback and not(@encapsulation))'><value-of select="."/> One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time</assert> <assert test='not(@loopback and (@bfdStaticRoutes eq 1))'><value-of select="."/> When loopback is set, value of bfdStaticRoutes attribute must be DISABLED</assert> <assert test='not(@loopback and ((count(AddressIPv4) ge 1) and (count(AddressIPv4[matches(@address,".+/32")]) lt 1)))'><value-of select="."/> Prefix length of loopback address must be /32</assert> <assert test='not((@loopback and @aclIngress) or (@loopback and @aclEgress))'><value-of select="."/> LOOPBACK interface is not allowed in ACL association</assert> <assert test='not((@aclIngress and (count(@aclIngress/AclEntryIpv4) eq 0)) or (@aclEgress and (count(@aclEgress/AclEntryIpv4) eq 0)))'><value-of select="."/> EMPTY AclIpv4 is not allowed in ACL association</assert> <assert test='not((@aclIngress and (../@routerId ne @aclIngress/../@routerId)) or (@aclEgress and (../@routerId ne @aclEgress/../@routerId)))'><value-of select="."/> Only AclIpv4 MO within SAME Router is allowed in ACL association</assert> <assert test='not((@aclIngress and contains(@encapsulation,"IpsecTunnel=")) or (@aclEgress and contains(@encapsulation,"IpsecTunnel=")))'><value-of select="."/> Ipsec Inner Interface is not allowed in ACL association</assert> <assert test='not((@bfdProfile and matches(@bfdProfile,".*,Router=.*,BfdProfile=.*") and (../@routerId ne @bfdProfile/../@routerId)))'><value-of select="."/>: BfdProfile may not refer to a different Router</assert> <assert test='not(@loopback and @egressQosMarking)'><value-of select="."/> The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IP Loopback interface</assert> <assert test='not(@egressQosMarking and contains(@encapsulation,"IpsecTunnel="))'><value-of select="."/> The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IPsec Inner interface</assert> <assert test='not(contains(@encapsulation,"IpsecTunnel=") and ((count(AddressIPv4) ge 1) and (count(AddressIPv4[matches(@address,".+/32")]) lt 1))'><value-of select="."/> Prefix length of Ipsec Inner interface address must be /32</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: mtu
attribute.description: The maximum transmission unit (MTU) for IPv4.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: interfaceIPv4Id
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: bfdProfile
attribute.description: BFD parameters used for BFD sessions from this IP interface.
attribute.dependencies: When bfdStaticRoutes is ENABLED, bfdProfile must refer to a valid BfdProfile MO.

attribute.name: loopback
attribute.description: Specifies if the interface is an IP Loopback Interface.
attribute.dependencies: One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time. Loopback cannot be set, if an ACL association exists, that is if aclEgress or aclIngress are set.The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IP Loopback interface.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: arpTimeout
attribute.description:
Specifies the average time that an entry remains in the ARP cache.
An entry is a dynamically learned IP address and its corresponding MAC address. The entry is then either refreshed, if the entry is still needed, or removed, if the entry is not needed any more.

attribute.name: bfdStaticRoutes
attribute.description:
Enables/disables BFD monitoring of static routing nexthops on this interface.
bfdStaticRoutes works in conjunction with bfdProfile, so to enable BFD monitoring, bfdStaticRoutes must be ENABLED, and bfdProfile must be defined. When BFD monitoring is enabled, all static routing nexthops on subnets of this IP interface will be monitored, unless explicitly disabled on peer/nexthop.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.
attribute.takesEffect: When changed, BFD sessions will be created or deleted accordingly.

attribute.name: aclEgress
attribute.description: A reference to an ACL MO applied in the egress direction. If this attribute is empty, no ACL MO filtering will take place in the egress direction.
attribute.dependencies: If this attribute is set, loopback cannot be set. The referenced AclIpv4 MO must have at least one AclEntryIpv4 as a child. Only AclIpv4 MOs within the same router are allowed in an ACL association. An IPsec Inner Interface is not allowed in an ACL association.

attribute.name: aclIngress
attribute.description: A reference to an ACL MO applied in the ingress direction. If this attribute is empty, no ACL MO filtering will take place in the ingress direction.
attribute.dependencies: If this attribute is set, loopback cannot be set.The referenced AclIpv4 MO must have at least one AclEntryIpv4 as a child. Only AclIpv4 MOs within the same router are allowed in an ACL association. An IPsec Inner Interface is not allowed in an ACL association.

attribute.name: pcpArp
attribute.description: Specifies the PCP value for ARP packets using this interface (affects only VLAN interfaces).

attribute.name: routesHoldDownTimer
attribute.description:
Specifies the holddown timer used for static and dynamic routes that use this interface.
If this attribute is set, a holddown timer is started when the conditions for a static route to become available have been fulfilled. When the holddown timer expires, the route becomes available.
Similarly, OSPFv2 uses this attribute to delay neighbor discovery on this interface (that is, until the interface is deemed reliably up) until routesHoldDownTimer has expired, counting from the time that the underlying L2 interface transitioned to an operational state of ENABLED.
If this attribute is empty, there is no hold-down timer for routes.
This attribute does NOT affect the operational state of the interface.

attribute.name: trustDSCP
attribute.description: Replaces queue systems in ingress directions for policing/remarking.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: egressQosMarking
attribute.description:
The DSCP to PCP map used for marking DSCP tagged packets with a PCP value. The packets marked are either host originated or routed into the QoS domain.
If empty, the DSCP values are mapped to PCP values according to the following:
pcp0 = 0 pcp1 (empty) pcp2 = 10,12,14 pcp3 = 18,20,22 pcp4 = 8,16,26,28 pcp5 = 34,36,38,46 pcp6 = 32,40,48 pcp7 = 51,54
attribute.dependencies: The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IP Loopback interface. The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IPsec Inner interface.

attribute.name: routingPolicy
attribute.description:
A Routing Policy used for Policy Based Routing.
The value is a reference to a Routing Policy.
If a reference is assigned, Policy Based Routing of incoming packets will be enabled.
attribute.dependencies: routingPolicy can only be set when encapsulation is set to EthernetPort, VlanPort or Bridge. The referred RoutingPolicyIPv4 MO instance must belong to the same Router MO instance.

attribute.name: encapsulation
attribute.description: Reference to the underlying encapsulation, which can be an EthernetPort MO or a VlanPort MO. For InterfaceIPv4, this attribute can also refer to a Bridge MO or an IpsecTunnel MO.
attribute.dependencies: A VlanPort MO and an InterfaceIPv4 MO or InterfaceIPv6 MO cannot refer to the same EthernetPort MO. Applicable for InterfaceIPv4: One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time. Applicable for InterfaceIPv6: This attribute must be set. If InterfaceIPv4 and InterfaceIPv6 encapsulates the same VlanPort they must reside in the same router. If InterfaceIPv4 and InterfaceIPv6 encapsulates the same EthernetPort they must reside in the same router.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

class.name: AddressIPv4
class.description: Assigned IPv4 address including information about the subnet it resides on.

attribute.name: addressIPv4Id
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: IPv4 decimal address + "/" + prefix length <0-32>.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

mim.author: EAB/FJP/TA UABERPE
mim.name: RtnL3InterfaceIPv6
mim.description: IPv6-addressed termination point; interface on an IPv6 routing domain.

enum.name: OperState
enum.description: The operational states of a resource.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is totally inoperable.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable.

enum.name: AvailStatus
enum.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value.

enumMember.name: IN_TEST
enumMember.description: The resource is undergoing a test procedure. If the administrative state is locked or shutting down then normal users are precluded from using the resource.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating.

enumMember.name: POWER_OFF
enumMember.description: The resource requires power to be applied and is not powered on.

enumMember.name: OFF_LINE
enumMember.description: The resource requires a routine operation to be performed. This routine operation is to place the resource online and make it available for use. The operation may be manual or automatic, or both. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_DUTY
enumMember.description: The resource has been made inactive by an internal control process.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY
enumMember.description: The resource cannot operate because some other resource on which it depends is unavailable.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The service available from the resource is degraded in some respect.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The resource represented by the managed object is not present, or is incomplete.

enumMember.name: LOG_FULL
enumMember.description: This indicates a log full condition.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is locked. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency locked.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_FAILED
enumMember.description: The availability status of a resource that this resource depends on is failed or dependency failed.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is shutting down. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency shutting down.

derivedDataType.name: Ipv6AddressAndPrefixLengthStr
derivedDataType.description:
Unicast Ipv6Address (colon separated, rfc4291, without leading 0s) / prefix_length 0-128.
Example: 2001:DB8::8:800:200C:417A/64

class.name: InterfaceIPv6
class.description: IPv6-addressed termination point; interface on an IPv6 Routing Function.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='@encapsulation'><value-of select="."/> The attribute encapsulation must be set </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='@encapsulation'><value-of select="."/> The attribute encapsulation must be set </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: mtu
attribute.description: The maximum transmission unit (MTU) for IPv6.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: interfaceIPv6Id
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: neighborDiscoveryTimeout
attribute.description:
Timeout value for the neighbor entry.
Configures how long the remote IPv6 node is considered reachable after the reachability confirmation event has occurred. A value of zero means that entries are never cleared from the cache.

attribute.name: neighborSolicitationInterval
attribute.description: Interval between the retransmitted neighbor solicitation messages on an interface.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: routesHoldDownTimer
attribute.description:
Specifies the holddown timer used for static routes that use this interface.
When this attribute is set, a holddown timer is started when the conditions for a static route to become available have been fulfilled. When the holddown timer expires, the route becomes available.
When not set, there is no hold-down timer for routes.
This attribute does NOT affect the operational state of the interface.

attribute.name: egressQosMarking
attribute.description:
The DSCP to PCP map used for marking DSCP tagged packets with a PCP value. The packets marked are either host originated or routed into the QoS domain.
If empty, the DSCP values are mapped to PCP values according to the following:
pcp0 = 0 pcp1 (empty) pcp2 = 10,12,14 pcp3 = 18,20,22 pcp4 = 8,16,26,28 pcp5 = 34,36,38,46 pcp6 = 32,40,48 pcp7 = 51,54

attribute.name: dscpNdp
attribute.description: The Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) value for Neighbor Discovery Protocol (NDP).

attribute.name: aclEgress
attribute.description: A reference to an ACL MO applied in the egress direction. If this attribute is empty, no ACL MO filtering will take place in the egress direction.
attribute.dependencies:
This attribute can be set only when encapsulation refers to a VlanPort, an EthernetPort, or a Bridge MO.
The referenced AclIpv6 MO must have at least one AclEntryIpv6 as a child. Only AclIpv6 MOs within the same router are allowed in an ACL association.

attribute.name: aclIngress
attribute.description: A reference to an ACL MO applied in the ingress direction. If this attribute is empty, no ACL MO filtering will take place in the ingress direction.
attribute.dependencies:
This attribute can be set only when encapsulation refers to a VlanPort, an EthernetPort, or a Bridge MO.
The referenced AclIpv6 MO must have at least one AclEntryIpv6 as a child. Only AclIpv6 MOs within the same router are allowed in an ACL association.

attribute.name: encapsulation
attribute.description: Reference to the underlying encapsulation, which can be an EthernetPort MO or a VlanPort MO. For InterfaceIPv4, this attribute can also refer to a Bridge MO or an IpsecTunnel MO.
attribute.dependencies: A VlanPort MO and an InterfaceIPv4 MO or InterfaceIPv6 MO cannot refer to the same EthernetPort MO. Applicable for InterfaceIPv4: One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time. Applicable for InterfaceIPv6: This attribute must be set. If InterfaceIPv4 and InterfaceIPv6 encapsulates the same VlanPort they must reside in the same router. If InterfaceIPv4 and InterfaceIPv6 encapsulates the same EthernetPort they must reside in the same router.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

class.name: AddressIPv6
class.description: Assigned IPv6 address including information about the subnet it resides on.

attribute.name: addressIPv6Id
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: IPv6 address + "/" + prefix length<0-128>.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

mim.author: EAB/FJP/TA UABERPE
mim.name: RtnIP_
mim.description:
Decision MOM for RtnIP.
Shall not be visible.

derivedDataType.name: IpDNSAddress
derivedDataType.description: The IpDNSAddress type represents an IP address or a DNS domain name. A version 4 IP address is specified in dotted quad notation, for example 130.100.92.154. RFC 791 describes the syntax details. A version 6 IP address is specified by 8 groups of 16 bit hexadecimal values separated by colons, for example 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334. RFC 4291 describes the syntax details. A DNS name is specified as a fully qualified domain name, for example myhost.ericsson.com. Internet domain are loosely specified but RFC 1034 recommends a syntax.

attribute.name: dnsClientId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: serverAddress
attribute.description: Specifies a list of addresses of DNS servers.

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description: The Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) value for DNS related IP packets. Only IP packets originated from the node are tagged with the DSCP value.
